H0.text: Combustion engine is a complex machine that burns fuel to produce thermal energy and then uses the thermal energy to do work.

H1.text: A vapor engine is a complex machine that burns fuel to produce thermal energy and then uses the thermal energy to do work.

H2.text: Convection oven is a complex machine that burns fuel to produce thermal energy and then uses that thermal energy to do work.

H3.text: Battery is a complex machine that burns fuel to produce thermal energy and then uses that thermal energy to do work.

A4.text: The combustion process typically results in the production of a great quantity of thermal energy, as well as the production of steam and carbon dioxide and other chemicals at very high temperature; the temperature reached is determined by the chemical make up of the fuel and oxidizers (see stoichiometry), as well as by the compression and other factors.

A5.text: This process transforms chemical energy into kinetic energy which is used to propel, move or power whatever the engine is attached to.
